conclusion: Need to calculate the electromotive force (EMF) induced in the wire due to the changing magnetic field using Faraday's law.
The wire frame is a square with a side length of 0.2 m, and half of the square is in the magnetic field.
The area of the loop in the magnetic field is 0.02 m^2.
The magnetic field B is increasing at a rate of 10 T/s.
The rate of change of magnetic flux is 0.2 Wb/s.
The induced EMF is -0.2 V according to Faraday's law.
The potential difference between points a and b is 0.2 V.
